tit.cmt: 人名（呼称）につき、ローマ字で表しました。

sen.j: 奈良義成の妹（ならよしなりのいもうと、生没年不詳）は、安土桃山時代の貞婦。
sen.e: NARA Yoshinari no imouto (Yoshinari NARA's younger sister, years of birth and death unknown) was known as a chaste woman who lived in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
NARA Yoshinari no imouto (Yoshinari NARA's younger sister, years of birth and death unknown) was known as a chaste woman who lived in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 和歌を好み、書をよくした。
sen.e: Yoshinari's younger sister was fond of 'waka' (Japanese poetry), being good at 'sho' (calligraphy).
Yoshinari's younger sister was fond of 'waka' (Japanese poetry), being good at 'sho' (calligraphy).

sen.j: 奈良義成は、永禄年間、伏見に寓し、西岡のひと貞光久左衛門について笛をまなんだ。
sen.e: Yoshinori NARA who lived temporarily in Fushimi during the Eiroku era, learned the flute under Kyuzaemon SADAMITSU of Nishioka.
Yoshinori NARA who lived temporarily in Fushimi during the Eiroku era, learned the flute under Kyuzaemon SADAMITSU of Nishioka.

sen.j: 久左衛門は、奈良義成の妹の容色にめでて妻金氏を離別し、妹を妻にしたいともとめた。
sen.e: Kyuzaemon admired the beauty of Yoshinari NARA's younger sister and wished to marry her by devorcing his wife of the Kon clan.
sen.cmt: 「妻金氏」とありますが、「金（こん）家出身の妻」という解釈で訳出しました。
sen.e: Kyuzaemon admired the beauty of Yoshinari NARA's younger sister and wished to marry her by divorcing his wife of the Kon clan.
Kyuzaemon admired the beauty of Yoshinari NARA's younger sister and wished to marry her by divorcing his wife of the Kon clan.

sen.j: 義成は、人倫にもとるとしてこれを辞し、ひそかに母と話し合い妹をさとし、野村高藤と婚を約した。
sen.e: Yoshinari declined this proposal of marriage for moral reasons, and persuaded the sister with their mother to engage herself to Takafuji NOMURA.
sen.cmt: 「人倫」＝人道ですので、直訳ですと for humanitarian reasonsを充てるべきですが、ここではfor moral reasonsのほうが適していると考えました。野村高藤の読み不明。
sen.e: Yoshinari declined this proposal of marriage for moral reasons, and persuaded the sister with their mother to engage herself to Takafuji NOMURA.

sen.j: たまたま三好党（三好三人衆）が乱をおこし、将軍足利義昭を本国寺におそった。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the Miyoshi clan (the Miyoshi Triumvirs) rebelled and raided Shogun Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA at Honkoku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「三好党」(literally, the Miyoshi party) はそのままでは定訳不明ですが、本によっては三好氏the Miyoshi clan 又は「三好三人衆」 the Miyoshi Triumvirs http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=T2_5_W7UFXwC&pg=PA53&dq=Honkokuji+incident&hl=ja&ei=6KXvS6PIFYvk7APxk7CfBg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CDAQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=Miyoshi&f=false の通称が使用されていますので、補足訳出しました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the Miyoshi clan (the Miyoshi Triumvirs) rebelled and raided Shogun Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA at Honkoku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 義成もこれにくわわり、軍は敗れ東寺にはしった。
sen.e: Yoshinari participated in the Miyoshi party's rebel, but they were defeated and escaped to the Toji-Temple.
Yoshinari participated in the Miyoshi party's rebel, but they were defeated and escaped to the Toji-Temple.

sen.j: 久左衛門は、ひごろの鬱憤をはらすのはこのときにありと、義成を追った。
sen.e: Kyuzaemon hunted down Yoshinari so as to wreak his routine anger on that occasion.
Kyuzaemon hunted down Yoshinari so as to wreak his routine anger on that occasion.

sen.j: 義成は返し合せてこれに死んだ。
sen.e: Yoshinari fought back, but was killed eventually.
Yoshinari fought back, but was killed eventually.

sen.j: 久左衛門は伏見に行き、妹をうばった。
sen.e: Kyuzaemon then went to Fushimi to seize the Yoshinari's younger sister there.
Kyuzaemon then went to Fushimi to seize the Yoshinari's younger sister there.

sen.j: 妹はいつわって、次のようにいい、毛髪を断ち、書中に同封して久左衛門に託した。
sen.e: The sister, in an attempt to beguile Kyuzaemon, had her hair cut and passed him a letter with a lock of her hair enveloped in it, telling him as follows:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「次のように」を補いました。
sen.e: The sister, in an attempt to beguile Kyuzaemon, had her hair cut and passed him a letter with a lock of her hair enveloped in it, telling him as follows:

sen.j: 「夫越中、左近と共に戦死し、わらわ今寡婦となりたれば、請う、君少しく哀憐を垂れ、願わくは書をもって家に致し、もって老母の情を慰めしめよ」
sen.e: "My husband Ecchu was killed in battle together with Sakon (literally, the Palace Guards of the Left, but the word probably specifies a person here), and that made me a widow now. Please, do have mercy on me. I beseech you to send this letter to my old mother awaiting at home for consolation."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「夫越中」は「夫の越中守」という意味かどうか不明です。また、「左近」が誰を指すのか（一説では島左近、しかし関ヶ原の戦いまで生きていたというのが通説）不明です。「左近衛府」の「将」であると思われますが、確認不可でしたので、少々曖昧に訳出してあります。
sen.e: "My husband Ecchu was killed in battle together with Sakon (literally, the Palace Guards of the Left, but the word probably specifies a person here), and that made me a widow now. Please, do have mercy on me. I beseech you to send this letter to my old mother awaiting at home for consolation."

sen.j: 久左衛門はひとを遣わせてこれを伏見におくった。
sen.e: Kyuzaemon sent a messenger with this letter to her mother living in Fushimi.
sen.cmt: 「伏見に住む老母」と補足・訳出しました。
sen.e: Kyuzaemon sent a messenger with this letter to her mother living in Fushimi.

sen.j: 老母がひらいてこれを見ると、歌があり、「思ひ河深き淵瀬は早けれどさそふ水には名を流さめや」と、つぶさにその状を報じていた。
sen.e: The aged mother opened the letter from her daughter to find a waka (poem) which fully explained her daughter's true situation as follows: "Omoigawa fukaki fuchi se ha hayakeredo/ sasou mizu ni ha na wo nagasameya" (which read: like the deep pool in the river of tears, I sank into an abyss of sorrow and despair; even if the things are changing too fast as the shallow water flows rapidly, how can I surrender myself to a man and gain a bad reputation? - I dare not do that.)
sen.cmt: 辞世の句「思ひ河深き淵瀬は早けれどさそふ水には名を流さめや」の解釈は既存のものが見つからず、当方の解釈で訳出しております。（涙の河の深く思いの澱んだ淵のように悲しみにくれている私は、浅い瀬の流れが速い[世の中や人の移り変わりが早い]からといって、誘い出す水[久左衛門のこと？]にこの名を流す[悪い評判をたてる？]ことなど、どうしてできるでしょうか）

sen.j: 老母はこれを見てかなしみのあまり使者の面前で自殺した。
sen.e: In her grief, the aged mother killed herself in front of the messenger.
In her grief, the aged mother killed herself in front of the messenger.

sen.j: 使者はおどろき帰ってこれを久左衛門に報じた。
sen.e: Shocked, the messenger returned and reported Kyuzaemon about what had happened to the aged mother.
Shocked, the messenger returned and reported Kyuzaemon about what had happened to the aged mother.

sen.j: 久左衛門はおおいによろこび、妹にいいよりせまった。
sen.e: The news greatly pleased Kyuzaemon, and he made an unwanted pass at the Yoshinari's younger sister.
The news greatly pleased Kyuzaemon, and he made an unwanted pass at the Yoshinari's younger sister.

sen.j: 妹はいかり、久左衛門の佩刀をうばってこれを刺し、みずからも腹を切って死んだ。
sen.e: Filled with anger, the Yoshinari's younger sister deprived Kyuzaemon of his 'hakashi' (nobleman's sword), with which she stabbed him to death and committed hara-kiri herself.
sen.cmt: 「佩刀」 はかしは太刀の一種で「はかせ」とも読みます。
sen.e: Filled with anger, the Yoshinari's younger sister deprived Kyuzaemon of his 'hakashi' (nobleman's sword), with which she stabbed him to death and committed hara-kiri (suicide) herself.

sen.j: のちに、織田信長はこれをきき、久左衛門の不義不仁をにくみ、その妻女をとらえて磔刑に処した。
sen.e: Learning about the Yoshinari's younger sister and Kyuzaemon, Nobunaga ODA condemned Kyuzaemon's adultery and lack of consideration and charity, thereby arresting Kyuzaemon's wife for execution and crucified her.
